cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast toward the Florida Panhandle, then expected to sweep east-northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas before emerging offshore of North Carolina and the western Atlantic late Sunday

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings stretch from the Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown, FL and from Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River (Gulf side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast of FL/AL/MS and the Atlantic coast from northern FL through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly to northeasterly winds could reach tropical-storm force (40–45 mph) Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the Atlantic side of northeast Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause ponding on terminal roadways and reduced visibility
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Saturday; short-period squalls may disrupt cargo handling
